person.persName: James Streshly Jackson (Hopkinsville, Kentucky attorney, soldier, and politician)

body.p: Hopkinsville, Kentucky attorney, soldier, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Buford Jackson. Father of David Jackson, James Berryman Jackson, Etta Jackson, and Juliet Jackson. Educated at Centre College. Graduated from Jefferson College in 1844. Graduated from Transylvania University in 1845 with a law degree and admitted to the bar. Practiced law in Greenupsburg, Kentucky, and Hopkinsville, Kentucky. Served as a private and third lieutenant with the First Kentucky Cavalry in Mexican-American War. Resigned on October 10, 1846, fearing a court martial as the result of a duel. Relocated to Hopkinsville in 1859. Unionist member of the House of Representatives of the United States from the second Congressional District of Kentucky from March 1861 to December 1861. Resigned and joined the U.S. Army. Colonel of the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment from December 1861 to July 1862. Promoted to brigadier general of U.S. Volunteers in July 1862. Killed at the Battle of Perryville on October 8, 1862.
